com.badlogic.gdx.graphics
Interface Texture

public interface Texture

A Texture represents a bitmap to be applied to a Mesh. It is constructed by an Application via one of the Application.newTexture() methods. It might get resized to better fit the architectures needs, e.g. to a power of two. To play it save only use power of two textures!

Author:
mzechner

          Binds this texture.

Method Detail

bind

void bind()
Binds this texture. You have to enable texturing via Application.enable( RenderState.Texturing ) in order for the texture to actually be applied to geometry.

draw

void draw(Pixmap pixmap,
          int x,
          int y)
Draws the given Pixmap to the texture at position x, y.

Parameters:
pixmap - The Pixmap
x - The x coordinate in pixels
y - The y coordinate in pixels

getImageWidth

int getImageWidth()
Returns:
the width of the original image in pixels

getImageHeight

int getImageHeight()
Returns:
the height of the original image in pixels

getWidth

int getWidth()
Returns:
the width of the texture in pixels

getHeight

int getHeight()
Returns:
the height of the texture in pixels

dispose

void dispose()
Disposes all resources associated with the texture
